unnormalised: ## Payment Gateways: Avoiding the 'Chillar' Headache in the Digital Bazaar
normalised: ## Payment Gateways: Avoiding the 'Small Change' Headache in the Digital Bazaar

unnormalised: Okay, so you've built your online "kirana store," selling everything from sustainably sourced Darjeeling tea to aunty-approved pickle recipes. Congratulations, beta! But hold on a minute, before you start counting your rupees, let's talk about the not-so-glamorous, but oh-so-crucial, world of payment gateways.
normalised: Okay, so you've built your online "corner store," selling everything from sustainably sourced Darjeeling tea to aunty-approved pickle recipes. Congratulations, beta! But hold on a minute, before you start counting your rupees, let's talk about the not-so-glamorous, but oh-so-crucial, world of payment gateways.

unnormalised: Think of a payment gateway as that slightly grumpy but ultimately reliable chaiwala, Sharmaji, at your local station. He’s the one making sure everyone gets their transactions sorted, one steaming cup at a time. Except, instead of hot chai and a few "chillar" short, he’s dealing with credit cards, UPI IDs, and enough digital wallets to make your head spin faster than a Garba dance.

unnormalised: Seriously, imagine running a Dussehra sale and not having a reliable payment gateway. Customers are adding sarees, diyas, and enough sweets to induce a sugar coma to their carts, only to be met with a dreaded "Transaction Failed" message. Chaos! Riots! You’ll be worse off than trying to find parking in Chandni Chowk on a Sunday.

unnormalised: Choosing the right gateway is like finding the perfect biryani – it needs the right blend of spices (features), it needs to be served hot (reliable uptime), and it shouldn't leave you with indigestion (hidden fees!). Are they compatible with your website built by your cousin Deepak who "knows computers"? Do they accept all those fancy new-fangled payment methods everyone in Bangalore is using? And most importantly, will it handle the sudden surge in orders when you announce a "Buy One, Get One Free" deal on your special Onam Sadhya meal kits?

unnormalised: Don't be a "phattu" (scaredy-cat)! Research, compare, and choose wisely. A good payment gateway is the silent hero behind every successful e-commerce business. It's what separates you from a thriving online marketplace to a digital dabba. Now go forth and conquer, and may your transactions always be successful! (And may Sharmaji always have enough change).
